name: Name
has-requested-you-to-review-and-sign: has requested you to review and sign
public-profile-help: This is your public URL. Copy or share it with the signer, and you will be able to see all your publicly set templates.
tagline-help: This Tagline will appear on your OpenSign public profile for ex. https://opensign.me/alex
password-case: Password should contain uppercase letter, lowercase letter, digit

report-help.Draft Documents: These are documents you have started but have not finalized for sending.
report-help.Need your sign: This is a list of documents that are waiting for your signature
report-help.In-progress documents: This is a list of documents you've sent to other parties for signature.
report-help.Completed Documents: This is a list of documents that have been signed by all parties.
report-help.Declined Documents: This is a list of documents that have been declined by one of the signers.
report-help.Expired Documents: This is a list of documents that have reached their expiration date.
report-help.Contactbook: This is a list of contacts/signers added by you. These will appear as suggestions when you try to add signers to a new document.
report-help.Templates: This is a list of templates that are available to you for creating documents. You can click the 'use' button to create a new document using a template, modify the document & add signers in the next step.

send-in-order-help.p1: Choose how you want the signing requests to be sent to the document signers:
send-in-order-help.p2: Selecting this option will send the signing request to the first signer initially. Once the first signer completes their part, the next signer in the sequence will receive the request. This process continues until all signers have signed the document. This method ensures that the document is signed in a specific order.
send-in-order-help.p3: Selecting this option will send the signing links to all signers simultaneously. Every signer can sign the document at their convenience, regardless of whether other signers have completed their signatures. This method is faster but does not enforce any signing order among the participants.
send-in-order-help.p4: Select the option that best suits the needs of your document processing.

select-folder-help: If you do not select a folder, your signed document will be saved in the Main OpenSign drive folder.
signers-help: Begin typing a contact's name to see suggested signers from your saved contacts or add new ones. Arrange the signing order by adding signers in the desired sequence. Use the '+' button to include signers and the 'x' to remove them. Each signer will receive an email prompt to sign the document in the order listed.
generate-token-alert: Are you sure you want to regenerate token it will expire old token?

document-signature.validate-alert-mssg: The input does not meet the criteria set by the regular expression.
